episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and humorous topics, including a robot hitchhiker's ill-fated journey, a Hungarian entrepreneur's fine for not building a dog treadmill, Elizabeth Taylor's posthumous punctuality, and Mexico's national championship of double entendres.

facts.fact: Hitchbott was a robot invented to see how far human kindness would take a mechanical Hitchhiker. In 2015 he was left on the side of the road in Boston and was found dismembered in a ditch 17 days later.
A Hungarian entrepreneur has been fined for not building an underwater treadmill for dogs.
The late actress Elizabeth Taylor, who was notorious for always being late, arranged to arrive at her own funeral 15 minutes late.
Mexico has a national championship of double entendres.
